Medieval Period

During the Middle Ages, flat Earth theories experienced a resurgence in

Europe. The Catholic Church played a significant role in promoting a flat

Earth, with some theologians arguing that a spherical earth contradicted

biblical descriptions of creation (Flat Earth and the Bible). This led to the

development of various flat Earth models, including the "Tychonic system,"

which placed the Sun and Moon on a series of crystal spheres above a

stationary flat earth.
